docs.title: System Overview
docs.text: Legacy Spring Boot Ticket Tracking system handling tickets and comments.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The comment management domain is responsible for creating and managing comments related to tickets.

docs.title: Business Logic
docs.text: • Create a new comment and associate it with a ticket

docs.title: Usage Examples
docs.text:
• Create a new comment: POST /comments with a JSON body containing the comment message and ticket id
  • Example JSON body: {"message": "This is a comment", "ticket": {"id": 1}}

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: A system for managing and tracking tickets, including creating, updating, and retrieving ticket information.

docs.title: API Endpoints
docs.text:
• GET /tickets — Retrieve a list of all tickets.
  • POST /tickets — Create a new ticket.
  • PUT /tickets/{id}/status — Update the status of a ticket with the given ID.

docs.title: Entities
docs.text:
• Ticket: id, title, description, status
  • TicketStatus: OPEN, IN_PROGRESS, CLOSED

docs.title: Business Logic
docs.text:
• Tickets can be created with a title, description, and initial status.
  • Tickets can be updated to change their status.
  • Tickets can be retrieved by ID or in a list of all tickets.

docs.title: Usage Examples
docs.text:
• Create a new ticket: POST /tickets with a JSON body containing title and description.
  • Update the status of a ticket: PUT /tickets/{id}/status with a query parameter status.
  • Retrieve a list of all tickets: GET /tickets
